activities.loc: Br 2 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Traoun D Oliver-Thomas

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM Defendant Traoun D Oliver-Thomas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Traoun D Oliver-Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Deft. appears via Zoom from Kettle Moraine.  Defense requests a plea hearing.  Defense asks the deft. appear via Zoom for the plea hearing.  Court performs colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant informs the court he would freely, voluntarily and intelligently waive his appearance for the plea hearing.   BTC: Deft. to appear via Zoom per State v. Anderson Colloquy.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
State's NOI to Intro Recorded Statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Traoun D Oliver-Thomas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Traoun D Oliver-Thomas. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
